intro: Senecio gramineticola, commonly known as the narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that are clustered in heads. Senecio gramineticola is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
